summary: The Climate Change Health Protection and Promotion Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish an Office of Climate Change and Health Equity within the Department of Health and Human Services. This office will develop and implement a national strategic action plan to prepare the healthcare sector for the health impacts of climate change. The bill defines key terms, outlines the office's duties (including assessments, data tracking, and public communication), and establishes an advisory board. It also mandates periodic reports and authorizes appropriations for the office, the action plan, and the advisory board.
